arm_group.description: After delivery of the newborn, umbilical cord at mothers end, will be left clamped until delivery of the placenta.
After delivery of the newborn, umbilical cord at mothers end, will be left unclamped until delivery of the placenta.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine if placental drainage shortens third period of
      labor and reduces postpartum blood lost.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Placental Drainage in the Third Stage of Labor: a Randomized Clinical Trial

detailed_description.textblock:
The study aims to compare the effectiveness of placental drainage versus maintenance of
      maternal cord clamped end in the third stage of labor to reduce postpartum blood loss.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Low risk pregnant women

          -  Pregnancy at term

          -  Women at low risk for assisted labor / delivery and postpartum care.

          -  Live Fetus

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Women under 18, mentally handicapped and indigenous;

          -  Women who agreed to participate signed the Informed Consent, but evolved to cesarean
             section or instrumental delivery by forceps;

          -  Instrumental Delivery by forceps or c-section

intervention.description: After delivery of the newborn, umbilical cord at mothers end, will be left unclamped until delivery of the placenta.

clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Placental Drainage in the Third Stage of Labor: a Randomized Clinical Trial

primary_outcome.description: Time from delivery of the baby to the delivery of the placenta
primary_outcome.measure: Duration of the third period of labor

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Instituto Materno Infantil Prof. Fernando Figueira

secondary_outcome.description: Volume of blood lost 24 hours after birth
use of aditional uterotonics ( prophylkatic use not included)

clinical_study.source: Instituto Materno Infantil Prof. Fernando Figueira
